sources.title: The Fallen Idol (1948)
sources.description: The Fallen Idol is a British mystery thriller film directed by Carol ReedThe film is based on Graham Greene's short story "The Basement Room" and features a cast that includes Ralph Richardson, Bobby Henrey, and Michèle Morgan. The story revolves around Philippe, the young son of a diplomat living in London. He idolizes Baines, the family butler, who entertains him with tales of adventure. When Baines's wife is found murdered, Philippe becomes convinced that Baines is innocent and tries to protect him, inadvertently complicating the investigation.

metadata.Plot: Philippe, an ambassador's son and good friend of Baines, major domo of the embassy, is confused by the complexities and evasions of adult life. He tries to keep secrets but ends up telling them. He lies to protect his friends, even though he knows he should tell the truth. Confusion reigns when Baines is suspected of murdering his wife and Philippe flips back and forth with the police.
metadata.Writer: Graham Greene, Lesley Storm, William Templeton
metadata.Actors: Ralph Richardson, Michèle Morgan, Sonia Dresdel
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. 7 wins & 7 nominations total
